column4: Hi, How would I go about making ubuntu 6.10 run the command 'opt/lampp/lampp start' on startup?
put it in /etc/rc.local then
you can put various commands to run at boot time in /etc/rc.local
you don't need a script to just run a command at boot
well, I'm doing it this way now, if it works, it's fine with me.
feel free to complicate things of course, but just sudo su -c 'echo opt/lampp/lampp start' >> /etc/rc.local would solve it for you
